intro: Securidaca cacumina, commonly known as the African senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. The botanical features of Securidaca cacumina make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
